Package http.server

Class WebServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.WebServer
  • public class WebServer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple HTTP Web Server in Java Supported HTTP methode : OPTIONS, GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, DELETE

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      (package private) static class  WebServer.HeaderType
      Represent the HTTP method for the build of the response

      WebServer()

    • Method Detail

      • start

        protected void start​(int port)
        Starting the WebServer in order to handle client's connection, their request and send an appropriate response. Finally, close the remote connection with the client.
        Parameters:
        port - the webserver port

      • handleClientRequest

        private void handleClientRequest​(java.net.Socket client,
                                 java.lang.String request,
                                 java.lang.String body)
        Handle a typical client request and his body in order to call the right HTTP-method handler It also verify that the HTTP Method requested is implemented and authorized.
        Parameters:
        client - the client sending the request
        request - the client request (header)
        body - the client body if present

      • appendToFile

        private void appendToFile​(java.lang.String path,
                          java.net.Socket client,
                          java.lang.String body)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Append the body in parameter to the resource located by the path in parameter. If the resource exist, just append the body. If it is not, create the resource with the body for content.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the wanted resource
        client - the client sending the request
        body - the body of the request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • executeDynamicScript

        private void executeDynamicScript​(java.net.Socket client,
                                  java.lang.String path,
                                  java.lang.String body)
        Execute a dynamic script on the WebServer
        Parameters:
        client - the client sending the request
        path - the path of the dynamic script resource
        body - the body of the request

      • executeCommand

        private java.lang.String executeCommand​(java.lang.String[] cmd)
        Execute a command on the server terminal on Runtime
        Parameters:
        cmd - the cmd to execute
        Returns:
        response from execution

      • sendResponse

        private void sendResponse​(java.net.Socket client,
                          StatusCode status,
                          java.lang.String contentType,
                          byte[] content,
                          java.lang.String contentLocation,
                          WebServer.HeaderType type)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        After a request, create an appropriate response for the client and send it depends on the HTTP method and many other variables (resource availablity, right of access, implemented http method, etc...)
        Parameters:
        client - the client sending the request and waiting for response
        status - the HTTP status code to return
        contentType - the content-type for header
        content - the content of the response
        contentLocation - the content-location for header
        type - the HeaderType depends on the http request method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        StatusCode

      • getFilePath

        private java.nio.file.Path getFilePath​(java.lang.String path)
        Get a file path from a resource file on the server '/' gives the index from the page
        Parameters:
        path - the file path to find (asked in the request)
        Returns:
        Path on the server with prefix ./res

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method starting the WebServer
        Parameters:
        args - the port used to start the WebServer
